Text:
Thanks for the ul, STFmaryville!  One can't have too much Ennis goodness these days!

Is there any chance that you might have THE SACRED AND THE PROFANE by Dean Motter & Ken Stacy in your treasure trove?

or even the Alan Moore adaptation "Light of thy Countenance" one-shot?  

No worries if you don't.

here's the moore book, binderguy1: thepiratebay.sx/torrent/8309502/

no luck on the sacred and the profane, and i hadn't heard of that one... but wow, i am a huge ken steacy fan. will look for it more when i have a chance.

The Sacred and the Profane came out in the '80's.

It was first serialized in Epic Illustrated for a bit, and if memory serves me right, and completed as a graphic novel for Eclipse Comics.

It's been awhile, so I could be wrong about who published it in final format.

your memory's much better than mine.
http://www.scificatholic.com/2007/09/sacred-profane.html

binderguy1, http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/5089704/

#20 through #26 have the The Sacred and The Profane, serialized as 7 chapters. i don't believe the work changed/improved when eclipse collected it later.
